meanings.definition: To work together towards a common goal.
meanings.sent1: The students decided to cooperate on the group project.
meanings.sent2: It is important to cooperate with your teammates in sports.
meanings.sent3: The animals had to cooperate to escape from the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The gears in the machine must cooperate smoothly to function properly.
meanings.sent5: The dancers must cooperate perfectly to perform the routine flawlessly.

meanings.definition: To be helpful or willing to work with others.
meanings.sent1: She always cooperates with her classmates during group activities.
meanings.sent2: If we all cooperate, we can finish the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The birds decided to cooperate and build a nest together.
meanings.sent4: The colors in the painting seem to cooperate harmoniously.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces need to cooperate to complete the picture.

meanings.definition: To act jointly or in compliance with others.
meanings.sent1: The countries agreed to cooperate on environmental issues.
meanings.sent2: When drivers cooperate on the road, accidents can be prevented.
meanings.sent3: The robots were programmed to cooperate in completing tasks.
meanings.sent4: The different departments need to cooperate for the project to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The musicians must cooperate to create a beautiful symphony.
